citations.narrative:
The facility is not keeping updated acquisition records for dogs on hand. At the time of inspection, the facility had 44 adult
dogs on hand and 54 puppies. Form 7005 had 54 adult dogs recorded as being present on the property and there was no
record for any of the puppies. Accurate acquisition/inventory information facilitates the inspection process and ensures
that dogs covered under the Animal Welfare Act can be traced. The licensee must make, keep, and maintain records
(forms 7005 and 7006) which fully and correctly disclose the required information concerning each dog purchased or
otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported,
euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records must include any offspring born of any
animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. Correct by 9/15/23

The attending veterinarian has not visited the premises in over 12 months. The last visit to the facility was 11/17/21,
approximately 22 months ago. Regularly scheduled visits are important to ensure the adequacy of veterinary care and
other aspects of animal care. Correct by ensuring the attending veterinarian visits the premises at least every 12 months.
The facility has an on-site visit scheduled for 9/12/23.

The attending veterinarian has not performed a head to tail examination of all dogs in the last 12 months. While the
veterinarian has provided medical care as needed to several dogs in the last year, the last time all the dogs were
examined by the veterinarian was 11/17/21. Regularly scheduled exams are necessary to provide for the health and well-
being of all dogs and ensure their adequate care. Correct by scheduling a complete physical exam by the veterinarian for
all dogs at least every 12 months. The veterinarian is currently scheduled to perform exams during his site visit on
9/12/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility is not keeping updated acquisition records for dogs on hand. At the time of inspection, the facility had 44 adult 
dogs on hand and 54 puppies. Form 7005 had 54 adult dogs recorded as being present on the property and there was no 
record for any of the puppies. Accurate acquisition/inventory information facilitates the inspection process and ensures 
that dogs covered under the Animal Welfare Act can be traced. The licensee must make, keep, and maintain records 
(forms 7005 and 7006) which fully and correctly disclose the required information concerning each dog purchased or 
otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, 
euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records must include any offspring born of any 
animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. Correct by 9/15/23 
3.13(a)(1) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The attending veterinarian has not visited the premises in over 12 months. The last visit to the facility was 11/17/21, 
approximately 22 months ago. Regularly scheduled visits are important to ensure the adequacy of veterinary care and 
other aspects of animal care. Correct by ensuring the attending veterinarian visits the premises at least every 12 months. 
The facility has an on-site visit scheduled for 9/12/23. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The attending veterinarian has not performed a head to tail examination of all dogs in the last 12 months. While the 
veterinarian has provided medical care as needed to several dogs in the last year, the last time all the dogs were 
examined by the veterinarian was 11/17/21. Regularly scheduled exams are necessary to provide for the health and well-
being of all dogs and ensure their adequate care. Correct by scheduling a complete physical exam by the veterinarian for 
all dogs at least every 12 months. The veterinarian is currently scheduled to perform exams during his site visit on 
9/12/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

n
